response.answer_text: Let me tell you a story. A very long time ago there was a person (beggar probably) sitting under a tree. A businessman passes by and observes the person taking nap under the tree and thought he should also rest there for a while and fell asleep. After some unknown time they both woke up, and started conversation. Beggar: “what do you do?” The businessman: “I buy stocks for people of my village and sell them who can’t afford to go to the city frequently, and what about you?” Beggar: “I just roam around the city and ask people for a little portion of their food, and that’s how I get enough to fill my stomach for one day, and then sleep here.” Businessman: “Why would you do that? Why don’t you find some job in the city and then earn money to live a better life?” Beggar: “Why do you think that I need a job?” Businessman: “So that you can earn some money.” Beggar: “Why do I need money?” Businessman: “To buy yourself a house, buy some good clothes and have good food.” Beggar: “Why do I need to buy these things?” Businessman: “For god sake, to live a happy life you damn idiot.” Beggar: “That’s what I’m doing right now. I’m happy” Businessman was shocked. But the story doesn’t end here. Before continuing his journey, businessman said, “You know, it’s a good thing that there are very few people like you in the world, because you don’t contribute anything to the society, from where you take all your food, the clothes that you wear. Even this tree here might have been planted by someone. There is a big difference between the people who work their a*** off and you, they give something back to the society. Everyone gives as per their capacity, some give a lot, some people give little, but they all do and that’s how the society improves. You have zero contribution to the society, Now how does it feel?” So the point is that having aims and desires, somehow improves the social structure, from which we receive a lot of things from our childhood to adulthood. After that it’s our turn to give it back to the society.

Aim can be seen as path which we are leading to and could be a reason to harmonise random acts we could be doing in absence of it. If discipline is one of the highest virtues that leads in a good and valuable life aim could be a product to help in disciplining the mind. This without aim one may be ignorance of further consequence preventing to be prepared well in advance about the steps ahead. If you understand the value of discipline and with it are prepared to navigate the life so the time constructively we may be able to address so many unknown variables that keep disturbing us. We learn by practice and thus if we gather random activity that is being done and convert into an aim the objective become clearer. The concentration then can help to focus and use effectively and efficiently helping us to gain experience that could have been alien to us. The life starts turning as meaningful experience is a joy in itself. The aim also helps in ascending our thinking and use it as ladder. The aim shall have an end but as we know now its importance we try to make a next aim and follow the same sequence with higher vigour to achieve. The process makes us efficient and has ingredient to make us aware that is transforming situation of higher order. Well there is a fall down situation if we try to see aim as one time activity when after its accomplishment change our view in its fruits only by adding desires and following a path for fulfilling them which never end. The Gita essence for enjoying the action not the fruits means the same. Having aim is an opportunity to enjoy the process or the steps which shall produce fruits in the path. We can stop for short interval to recharge and set another aim. In case we have enjoyed the process we must have learnt far more than the simple appearing things and the subtle points which a sincere devotee observes make them are richer in thoughts. This rich thoughts allow to work as universal quality in next aim and that would keep repeating. It is not only output of product but such mind are weaving human too and creating a culture in and around them enriching quality of people and so quality or mind. Would not that be a joy and really a greater success over any material one irrespective whatever one has achieved materially?

Desires are one of the most important factors in influencing our life: How? Let me explain you with a short story: Three friends, Mohan, Raj and Deep were discussing about their future dreams: Mohan: I wish to be a famous singer. Raj: I wish to be an investor. Deep: I just want to lead a cool life with lots of money and no work. After 10 years: Mohan is still struggling to be a famous singer, however his journey has started with short proposals. Raj is still working towards its goal in being an investor and working on future projects, meeting different businesssman and investors. Deep has involved himself in wrong company because his definition of being cool meant having liquor, smoking, hanging out with girls, going to discos, showing of costly gadgets. So for becoming rich quickly he has started selling drugs.  I guess you have got your answer as how desires influence our life. We get up with some desires in our mind, we perform every activity with the purpose of attainment of desires.

It was my mother’s desire to make me a good son, who has ethics and values added at every step of life, I became one. It was my father’s desire to make me up someone professional and hence I became one. My sister wanted something, my girlfriend wanted something, my teacher wanted something and I became everything. But, this was of the desires of others, I was nothing of my desire so those desires ruined me. Some desires have negative effects. Then I created my own desires, which hurt a few people, my parents, my girlfriend, my friends but you know what? I was happy and people who actually cared for me, stayed in any case. This is the power of desire, if they are yours, you have a happy life, if they are of other they give you a sad life. Cheers~!!

Giving a simplified answer for the simple yet powerful question. 1) Having an aim, however small or big, gives you a sense of meaning to your life to achieve something in life. 2) If you have an aim, you have a cause to live your life meaningfully. 3) Having an aim empowers you to do things that you might never have done otherwise. 4) You will save a lot of your time and energy if you stay focused on your aim. 5) Having a goal will make you want to live with passion. 6) Finally, accomplishing your goal can make you feel proud and confident and help you set higher goals next time. Desires are the root cause of all misery. Buddha, Mahavira, all enlightened people have been proclaiming this statement from ages. Today's world is driven by money and the rush to accumalate wealth. We all give our heart and soul to run after making money. There's no end to our desires and eventually we end up not enjoying our wealth. We become slaves to our desires and in turn our lives become empty, pointless and meaningless. It is good to go with the flow of life, to be happy and peaceful.

Desires are fuel for life for all of us except those who have taken their spiritual awareness to next level. For them, desires don't overpower their way of life because they get connected with greater source of truth and that truth becomes the life fuel. For all others, we need desires to create purpose to look forward to and to have a force to engage our mind. People who haven't expanded their spiritual awareness to higher level and yet for some reason have lost desires in life - they end up being acute cases of depression, suicidal tendencies and mental illness. Loss of desires could happen due to multiple reasons but irrespective of those reasons, if such scenario is detected, it must be dealt carefully. A good company of people and positive energy is extremely crucial. With love and blessings -Rakesh

Desire is the motivation behind success or even failure. Worldly desires are selfish and spiritual desires are virtuous. Sometimes we possess free will to control karma and some times not. We are lucky if spiritual desires are invoked in us. It can lead to euphoric bliss and ultimately salvation in that state. Material desires bring forth temporary gratification of the ego and thus will eventually face defeat in death. Now decide on what desires you need to focus on.

If you make your process of desiring into a conscious process, then desire is no more a problem. Then desire is a wonderful vehicle which will take you places. Even if you want to reach the ultimate you need a desire, isn’t it? Yes or no? Anyway the desire in you is longing for unboundedness, it is longing for unlimitedness, it is longing for the ultimate nature. You just have to bring awareness to it. If you bring awareness to your desiring process, it is a wonderful instrument. If it is finding unconscious expression, then it makes you run like madman. All the time it keeps you running endlessly. By Sadhguru

There is no point of life without aims or desires. God gave us this life to do something productive. We all are here to play a role in the world. To complete a dream,to bring a change. If we don't have any ambitions in our life, we will not progress. There will be no improvement. Ultimately, you're not more than a dead person. Thus, it's important to have goals, ambitions in our life. Chase it, achieve it. God bless you. :)

Desires always influence our life….Because desire is one of the important ingredients to live your life.Steve job once said stay hungry stay foolish ….what does this mean? It means never get settled ….be hungry for your desires..Because life is not worth until you have something or someone die for… Dream big do big and desire more…..

Do you need to survive? (I wish I knew the answer). If you do, you need desire. There cannot be survival without a desire for a survivor, There cannot be a survivor without the desire to survive. The so called survival instinct, is an instinct to exist only, not survive. The survival instinct is a false instinct and it's affecting us only through our perceiving it as real, but this is still just an effect of our beliefs.

Desire is most important because it is the motive force of this creation. The first desire is the desire to play. In play the attention is set on the object of play and the player or Conscious Self is forgotten. This forgetfulness leads to a feeling of lack and more desire arises, this carries on at infinitum creating all desires and their objects. When the Conscious Self is remembered as Pure Free and Forever the desire to play may continue but in that Knowledge, without any forgetfulness,of Self.  Then no energy is lost and life becomes a delightful play.

How can one live his life without any aims or desire. Take a simple example of a farmer - his priority is to work hard at fields and to earn bread for his family. So the farmer makes the duty to earn bread for his family as his aim. In the same way, all of us have some needs and desires for our life and to achieve them we set aims for ourselves.

Guilt free desire is a guiding light in this vast universe, aids our progress and leads to happiness. It is thus very much necessary. Guilt ridden desire is the darkness in this vast universe, aids our regress and leads to misery. It is thus very much to be avoided.
Because they are desires- things that you always want. Why won’t you want to fulfill all your desires in the one life you’ve got? Hence, they naturally become a driving factor of life.
The most important! Three things are also important Passion, Dedication, Persistence.The key to success in every sphere
